text: the blossom tree
once upon a time in the land of India a
rich merchant called a Lima was to sail
across the seas to sell his brocade and
cotton and wool Jade and gems to parts
of Europe and Central Asia in those days
these trips would take months so on the
eve of his departure the merchants
friends gathered at his home to wish him
luck as the merriment was going on one
of the friends asked the merchant in
between bites of sweet bread a Lima you
will be gone for a month you never told
us as to which of us do you wish to look
after your home your estate and your
warehouse in your absence
who don't worry brother my jig may we'll
take care of all of it what what key
that jig me who looks after your horses
yes sure
are you all right a llama
Jimmy is just a poor herdsmen and you
are leaving all your wealth and his care
what if he steals it and runs away how
foolish of you to trust a poor man who
is just disturbing instead of us who are
your equals in status and wealth
I have no jing-mei for years he is a
good faithful man and I don't look at
him as a servant he is my friend
all the equals can be friends o Lima no
matter how kind you are to a servant a
servant can never become a friend I
disagree Jigme has looked after me been
there for me like a friend he will not
agree like that let us take him to the
Buddha
maybe the Buddha will be able to make
him see his foolishness
so the merchants friends took him to
where the Buddha was preaching under the
banyan tree in the Twilight they
explained the situation to the Buddha
[Music]
tell him sir how can he trust a poor
servant to look after all his wealth
isn't it foolish especially when we his
friends of equal stature are ready to
take care of everything while he is gone
the Buddha simply smiled and told them a
story a long time ago there lived a king
in Banaras the king loved gardening and
he spent many a happy hour in his
beautiful garden at the palace while he
lovingly tended to all the flowers and
trees and shrubs
there was one tree he loved the most the
tree of blossoms nobody knew how old the
tree was but it stood in the middle of
the garden as a gigantic divine monster
whose roots went deep into the nether
regions of the earth and they said that
its branches reach the heavens the
entire city of Banaras was proud of this
ancient tree that some thought could
have been more than a thousand years old
anyone who saw it could not help but
admire its strength and size people who
saw it were so stricken by it that
nobody noticed a small tuft of Cuccia
grass growing near its roots one day the
king and the Queen were sipping tea in
the main chamber of the palace when a
few particles of plaster fell on the
king plaster the king looked up and saw
a crack in the ceiling that went right
to the enormous pillar that held the
ceiling it was clear that the footer was
breaking
and if it was not replaced the stealing
and the entire palace would collapse
killing everyone who was inside the
Kings saw the danger and immediately
sent his servants and carpenters to
search in the palace gardens to find a
tree strong enough to build the enormous
pillar with the servants searched the
gardens and came back with the news the
only tree strong enough to build a
pillar of this size is the blossom tree
sire oh my favorite tree are you sure we
have looked at every tree in the palace
gardens but none of them is strong
enough none but the blossom tree the
king was saddened to think of his
beloved blossom tree being cut down but
truly there was no other way I cannot
risk the lives of so many people who
stay in the palace just to save my
beloved tree fine cut it if you must the
spirit of the blossom tree and indeed
the spirits of all the other trees and
birds sensed the disaster that was about
to happen that the ancient mystical
blossom was to be cut down the birds
stopped
chirping the air became still the garden
became soaked in an aura of sadness and
lifelessness
that is when the spirit of the cush
aggressed spoke to the blossom the next
day when the woodcutters came to cut the
tree and were about to strike their axes
on its bark wait the tree seems to be
rotting here see the color of the park
yes and it is soft here we can not cut
this tree down it will never be strong
enough to make the massive pillar I do
not understand just yesterday this tree
was strong and tough and magnificent and
now it is rotting in pieces maybe we
were never meant to cut the tree down
when the woodcutters went away the birds
began chirping again the wind danced
beautifully around the branches and it
was as though someone had infused new
life and joy into the garden the blossom
tree became its own strong magnificent
self again the other trees were shocked
to see this it is all because of the
spirit of my friend the Cuccia he spoke
to the spirit of the chameleon who then
caused chameleons to climb on sit on my
trunk and change their color to that of
rotting bark so when the woodcutter saw
it it appeared as though my trunk was
rotting but how did you make your trunk
soft they're clever chameleons moved
quickly to where the wood cutters were
touching the bark so that instead of the
trunk they touched their soft bodies of
the chameleons and thought that the
trunk was soft and rotten truly Cuccia
when we so called maddy trees could do
nothing to help our friend it was your
wisdom that saved his life thank you and
with this the buddha stopped his story
friendship and trust are given to those
who are wise and faithful wisdom and
loyalty have nothing to do with the
status of a person we must look at the
inherent qualities of a person rather
than their outward appearances in terms
of wealth status age or occupation
hearing lists the merchant smiled at his
friends left the presence of the Buddha
humbled and wise indeed never again
would they judge a person on the basis
of money or status but rather they would
look at the values of person had and if
the person was wise and loyal they would
treat him or her with respect
